dareText: _C_ needs to make some toast, except _B_ is the toaster and _A_ is the bread.
_A_ needs to text their mom 'Happy Birthday!'
_B_ is the runway model and _A_ is the announcer. Put on a fashion show.
_A_ needs to break dance to a song chosen by _B_.
_A_ and _B_ need to put on a shadow puppet performance.
_A_ needs to wash their face...with beer.
_B_ is the chef, and _A_ is the bacon. Make it sizzle!
_A_ gives us their best spongebob squarepants impression.
_A_ is the bull and _B_ is the matador. Bullfight!
_B_ takes a funny photo of _A_ and _C_ sends the photo to their dad.
_A_ must act like a robot whose battery is slowly dying.
_A_ and _B_ must perform a dramatic soap opera scene about a stolen sandwich.
_A_ narrates everything _B_ does for the next 1 minute in a nature documentary voice. _B_ pretends to be a peacock during mating season.
_A_ must draw a self-portrait using only their non-dominant hand.
_A_ has to surf on _B_ and do their best impression of Luke wiping out.
_A_ has to sing the chorus of a popular song as if theyâ€™re underwater.
_B_ and _C_ form a throne for _A_ to sit on. _A_ must hold court asking the citizens (the rest of the group) for their grievances against the birthday boy.
_A_ gives a 30-second TED Talk about why socks are better than shoes.
_A_ and _B_ act out a scene where _B_ is a dog and _A_ is its owner. _A_ forgot poop bags.
_A_ is the momma bird trying to feed _B_ the baby bird. _B_ does not want to eat.
_A_ must keep a straight face while _B_ does their best pterodactyl impression.
_A_ and _B_ perform a duet, using only the birthday boy's body for music.
_A_ and _B_ must do their best impression of the birthday boy talking to himself.
_A_ has to balance a spoon on their nose and pretends to be a scratch post...while _B_ pretends to be a cat.
_A_ must crawl around like a crab and convince the birthday boy to take his shirt off.
_A_ is _B_'s therapist, convincing them they're using too much toothpaste.
_A_ must pretend the floor is lava for 30 seconds. _B_ is the lava monster.
_A_ and _B_ create a secret handshake. They must teach everyone without the birthday boy finding out.
_A_ has to put on a puppet show using the birthday boy as their only prop.
_A_ must compliment the birthday boy using only surfing metaphors.
_A_, _B_, and _C_ play duck duck goose around the birthday boy.
_A_ sits in the middle of the circle and makes platypus sounds until the next round.
_A_ is the birthday boy's angel, _B_ is the birthday boy's devil. They have an argument about the birthday boy using a butt plug.
_A_ and _B_ are podcast hosts. They bring on their celebrity guest, the birthday boy.
_B_ must steal something from the birthday boy. _A_ must solve the mystery of what was stolen.
_A_ has to recite the alphabet backwards while hopping on one foot. _B_ does their best to distract _A_.
_A_ and _B_ are on a cooking show. They're making shithole...pie? They have to tell us what region of the world it's from and how to make it.
_A_ has to make a hat out of nearby objects and wear it for the next round.
_A_ is a sleep-deprived scientist and _B_ is their experimental talking plant. _C_ is the journalist interviewing them.
_A_ and _B_ must reenact a dramatic scene from a telenovela about a missing sock. _C_ is the sock.
_A_ gives a weather forecast of the birthday boy's emotional state.
_B_ must convince _A_ that their body is being replaced by spaghetti. _A_ reacts accordingly.
_A_ and _B_ come up with instructions on how to drink. The birthday boy must follow their instructions to drink.
_A_ and _B_ must act out a cooking competition where the main ingredient is the birthday boy. _C_ is the judge.
_A_ and _B_ are racist wizards who were caught casting not approved spells. They are currently in an HR meeting with _C_.
_A_ must make an infomercial selling the birthday boy as a product. _B_ is the skeptical customer.
_A_ and _B_ are royal horses. Have the birthday boy ride in to attend the ball in style.
_A_ and _B_ are fortune tellers giving the birthday boy a dramatic reading of his palms.
_A_ and _B_ must act like a medieval bard singing the tale of the birthday boy's greatest achievement.
_A_ is a game show host. _B_ and _C_ are the contestant answering trivia questions about the birthday boy's life. The answers must be made up.
